description: The Free Merchant Certified Note, also known by names such as a 'c-note' or 'merch', is a currency based on old American bills.  Fifty dollar bills and larger are printed with a promissory note signed by the treasurer of the Free Merchants, along with a complex design.  The note explains that this can be exchanged for food, water, and other services through the Free Merchants in the Refugee Center.
//: $50 bills have substantial pre-Cataclysm value, but are worth 1 meat jerky

description: This is a small but surprisingly heavy gold coin.  One side is etched with circuitry and the other side reads 'Hub 01 exchange currency'.
//: Low carat gold alloy for hardness, but it's still the best part of an ounce of gold.  Yes, the weight is correct for the volume.

description: This is a coin that has been flattened in a novelty coin flattening machine.  The machine has been somewhat crudely altered so that the design - which appears to once have been Mickey Mouse - is overlaid with a handwritten emblem of a book.  There is some text that faintly reads 'Campus Exchange Token'.
This is a slip of paper signed by the issuer.
This is a small picture, about the same size as an ID card, symbolizing a religious figure.  On the back, there is a text that faintly reads 'New England Church Community'.
A now-ancient form of currency.  Stripped of its original purpose, it now serves, faithfully, flippant Flippists for free.  George Washington is on this coin.
An ancient form of currency bearing the inscription "E PLURIBUS UNUM.".  Thomas Jefferson is on this coin.
A once near worthless coin may have value now due to the material it's made from.  Abraham Lincoln is on this coin.
An ancient form of currency.  Franklin D. Roosevelt is on this coin
A one dollar bill, pretty useless now though.  George Washington is on this bill.
A five dollar bill, pretty useless now though.  Abraham Lincoln is on this bill.
A ten dollar bill, pretty useless now though.  Alexander Hamilton is on this bill.
A twenty dollar bill, pretty useless now though.  Andrew Jackson is on this bill.
A fifty dollar bill, pretty useless now though.  Ulysses S. Grant is on this bill.
A hundred dollar bill, pretty useless now though.  Benjamin Franklin is on this bill.
